availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Woodsmall (Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James Woodsmall and Sarah Mount Woodsmall. Married to Lucy M. Head Woodsmall in Oldham County, Kentucky, on June 21, 1858. Father of James Woodsmall and Sallie Woodsmall. Laborer in Oldham County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Farmer in Oldham County in 1860. Farmer in Oldham County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 131B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 347.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 909.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, City/District, p. 331A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Oldham County, KY, June 1863, p. 445.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film 000482442.
